caption:
This photograph captures a mystical and atmospheric night-time scene. In the foreground, there are silhouettes of numerous dead or leafless trees standing against the night sky. These trees are mostly straight and tall, suggesting they may be in a forest affected by fire or some natural decay.

The background of the image is fascinating, it appears to be a swirling mass of light patterns or spray, possibly water droplets catching the light, giving off a mist-like or cosmic effect. This illuminated mist partially obscures the trees and adds to the image's enigmatic quality.

Toward the center, slightly to the upper left, is a bright, almost celestial light source. It could be the moon or another intense light source behind the mist, casting a brilliant light that pierces through, highlighting individual droplets or particles within the swirling mist. This light source is bright and acts as a focal point that draws the eye amidst the darker tones.

The overall composition and the play of light and dark create a compelling, almost ethereal visual experience with an interplay of natural elements and light. The image holds a sense of mystery, emphasizing themes of solitude and the wildness of nature.
title: Water falling down the steep slope of a clear-cut. An example of how timberland soil erodes away when steep slopes are clear-cut. Olympic National Timberland near Olympic National Park, Washington. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of Forests". For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213. ENTHEOS. April, 1973.
